runs.comm: decent start from Chigumbura, a full length on middle and off, and Gilchrist flicks off his pads to start the proceedings
tucked up again, and nudged away behind square. Good tight line so far. No room to free the arms... yet
oops, there was a bit more room there. Short and outside off, and Hayden's first shot is a brutal pull in front of square. The Aussies are off

would you believe it! Outside off, nipping away off the seam in the damp conditions, and Hayden's massive swipe finds only the thinnest of edges! Jubilation for the Zimbabweans, and the first wicket is down
a sighter outside off stump, and an expansive leave from Ponting.
a tidy line to finish, and Chigumbura takes his sweater at the end of a nerve-settling and successful over. First blood to Zimbabwe
good wheels, Brenty, good wheels. No great pace, but accurate enough
too far down the leg-side this time
even further down leg-side. And swinging as well. That's useful, but only if you can control it ...
back on a good length outside off, and defended into the covers with a loud "no!"
tucked up on the legs and Ponting calls Gilchrist through for a scampered single.
drawn forward in a circumspect defensive stroke. Very respectful play so far from Australia
whipped off the legs, but fielded with a juggle at short midwicket.
floated onto leg stump and on-driven, but midwicket fields well with a dive. Australia, dare one say it, are being a little tied down for the moment
driven down to deep backward point

short and Gilchrist goes for the pull ... but miscues it horribly! The ball spirals into the dank Newlands heavens and midwicket pouches a comfortable catch! Australia, in their first competitive match since the World Cup final, are in something resembling disarray ...
defended watchfully. What must the skipper be thinking right now?
defended again
half-driven to cover. No room for manoeuvre
a massive biff this time from Ponting, but that shot just plugs in the turf at cow corner like a Tiger Woods approach shot. Tough times for the Aussies
dabbed down to third man for a welcome single
pushed onto the back foot and driven to point. No way through there
Ponting's had enough of beating around the bush. He uses his feet gloriously and picks the gap in the covers with expert timing.
lovely outswinger to follow up, and a neat take from Taylor
stifled appeal as Ponting shuffles across his stumps, but nothing doing from the umpire. Testing times ...

well well well well ... Ponting uses his feet again, and this time he perishes! A wild swing finds only an outside edge, and after an eternity third man steadies himself to claim a massive wicket! Australia, officially, are in strife.
a change of bowling, and a watchful start from Hussey who left well alone outside off stump
width again, but left alone again
tempting line, just begging to be biffed. But Hussey isn't going to fall for it just yet. He's got a job to do here ...
tighter to the stumps, but Hussey can't work it away square. No pace to utilise at all
driven, but uneasily, out to cover
wide of off stump, and this time it's called, a little harshly, if you ask me. Meanwhile, there's massive support for Zimbabwe in the stands. Everyone loves an underdog
excellent line and length from Brent, jagging back into Hussey just enough to hurry his defensive stroke
going across the batsman this time, and nibbled at uneasily. Hussey is looking extremely rusty in the rain
lovely delivery, swinging across the left-hander's bows and through to the keeper
on the pads and clipped away. A welcome run for the beleaguered Aussies
zips through to the keeper as Symonds is caught flat-footed in an attempted drive
a stifled appeal as Brent zips one off the seam and into Symonds' pads. Not out is the verdict, but that's another precious dot ball
pushed into the covers and another jogged single, Hussey simply hasn't found his timing yet and Taibu cleans up
forced behind point with a slashing drive, but there's not enough pace on the ball to beat the field
right on the spot again and defended back down the track with the most vertical bat of the tournament so far
slashed urgently out to the cover sweeper. Runs are coming at a trickle
good areas once again, as the cliche goes. But areas are what it's all about for Zimbabwe
bad areas that time, swinging away down the leg-side
a fraction too short this time, and Symonds leaps into the offering like a starving man - and given his size you can imagine how hungry he must be. The ball beats third man for a rare boundary.
Chibhabha replaces the excellent Brent, and starts accurately enough
right on the spot again. No pace to work with at all
defended with an angled bat, and Hussey hustles through for an urgent single
fuller length but excellent line. Symonds tries to bludgeon his way through the covers, but can't get it away

another boundary for Symonds, but it's not his most elegant - a sliced drive down to third man, which trickles across the rope as two fielders slide into each other. It's sluggish batting and a sluggish outfield, and it's suiting Zimbabwe just fine
lovely drive, and a confident strike as Hussey makes room and places his lofted drive superbly
a squeaked appeal as Hussey cramps himself for room
flicked out to the midwicket sweeper
a low full-toss, but Symonds doesn't capitalise, driving firmly but carefully down to long-on
nudged out to midwicket for another single
nearly a terrible mix-up as Symonds hurtles back for a chancy third bye. Hussey attempted a reverse-sweep, nutmegged the keeper, but picked up some vital runs nonetheless
Hussey dances down the track but is forced to adjust into a late defensive prod as Chibhabha hits the seam

Sibanda pulls off a brilliant direct hit from point, and Hussey is on his way! That's a massive wicket. He dropped the ball into the off side and set off for the run, but was sent back as Sibanda swooped and hit with one stump to aim at
lovely delivery, nips off the seam to collective "oohs" from Zimbabwe fielders and fans alike
dabbed down to third man, and Hodge is off the mark
poor delivery, which is called a wide, but it could have been much worse. It was a leg-side long-hop and an off-form Symonds would have deposited that into the brewery
nudged away for another single
perfect line, perfect length, and a defiant defensive shot to finish.
driven back to the bowler who tidies up
down the track to straight drive back over his head
waited, waited and adjusted at the last minute with a poke to midwicket
uncontrolled dink to midwicket, one hand flying up off the bat - but an easy enough single
driven towards mid-on, the bowler pouncing on to it
a fluff at third man, but the outfield's slow and the fielder makes quick amends
short and punished through midwicket
worked out to the cover boundary and quickly returned
straighter, driven back to the bowler
run down to third man for a quick single
swivelled down to square leg
a touch outside off, driven uppishly towards deep extra cover
a big slash to a wideish one - and he missed it
very wide and Hodge was kind, I think, in reaching out for that and cut through cover
driven forward for a quick single
straighter, but still with enough width to run down to third man - and then they take an extra run through some sloppy fielding
wide and cut lateish behind point
up there, defended on the back foot towards the bowler
driven wide out towards deep midwicket for a quick single
the first six of the evening, and that went a long way - whisked up and over mid-on with a powerful front-foot strike. Clean and cool
driven to cover for a quick single
sharp work from Brendan Taylor as Symonds slipped moving forward while looking to cut. Forget the replays, Symonds looked immediately worried - and so he should have done
pushed on the back foot, defended down
on the back foot, played behind point
immediately on the money, poked down defensively
same ball, same result
worked out to cover for a quick single
booming lob of a full toss, horrible, but at that deceptively difficult knee height - it can only be driven back out to long-on
worked to short midwicket
great over finishes with an easy drive to long-on
down the leg-side, chased round - but too late
on the money, defended forward
nipped in a touch from outside off, picked out cover
tight delivery again, defended forward
deposited over deep midwicket - hard
full toss, turned off the legs to deep midwicket
driven out to long-on where Brent returns that well, receives cheers and gives the crowd the thumbs up
veering down leg, and driven back out to long-on
pulls that from outside off, up in the air swirling away to the right of Chigumbura who runs round - and he has to be quick - to meet the ball out towards long-on
poked to midwicket for a quick two
worked out to midwicket again
pitches outside off, waited, and driven off the back foot into the covers
outside off again, nipping in a fraction, driven back out through the covers
huge swing and a miss to third man
cut strongly out to the point boundary this time
full toss, waist height, poked back down off the back foot
full and swung away through the off-side, through the covers, and on its way
over extra cover for a loopy six
pushed forward for a quick strike-stealing single
crashes a huge inside edge back onto the sticks, sending the off stump - and Lee - on their way
outside off, touch of room, run down for an easy single to third man
good variation, tricky slower ball zooming in full on middle-and-leg, but worked well out to midwicket
stays over the wicket to the left hander, room outside off, stunned into the ground
full toss and Johnson opens his shoulders with some nice timing in front of midwicket, a good drive
three on the off-side this time, Johnson will now be back on strike
swung into the ground to cover for what had to be a rapid single
outside off, driven firmly through extra cover and Hodge hardly left his crease

scramble for a single down to third man, but a fast return and is sent on his way through a stunning run-out from Taylor, almost ten-pin bowling down the one stick he had to aim at (throwing with his gloved hand)
swipe into the off-side
cleanly struck lofted drive up to long-off, where it plugs again
chipped out to the man at deep cover and the innings ends with a catch - and so a dot
